comments.body: Use the in_arg and out_arg fields to populate inputs and outputs: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/273981699d92c1aa08ca52af99ee187ce5aaa5e1/tensorflow/core/framework/api_def.proto#L79
This file is auto-generated by tensorflow tools. Do you want me to change them? Wouldn't it break next time they are autogenerated again?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +72,76 @@      side is less than `min_size`.
      Inputs:
      `scores`: A 4D tensor of shape [Batch, Height, Width, Num Anchors] containing the scores per anchor at given postion
      `bbox_deltas`: is a tensor of shape [Batch, Height, Width, 4 x Num Anchors] boxes encoded to each anchor
      `anchors`: A 1D tensor of shape [4 x Num Anchors], representing the anchors.

comments.body: Please make this an input as well, it's weird that pre_nms_topn is an input but post_nms_topn is an attribute.

This affects the output shape. I was told before that the attributes that change the output shape should be attributes not inputs. If I do it, this will be a data dependent op. Do you really want that?
why there are 5 elements each row if it only has height, width and scale? This makes no sense

diffHunk:

    description: <<END
